doc.field: Series V. Civil War and Post-War Period
Series V. Civil War and Post-War Period
New-York Historical Society collection of caricatures and cartoons
New-York Historical Society collection of caricatures and cartoons

After the Chivalrous defeat of 60 men at Fort Sumter by 12,000 Confederate Troops Jeff Davis sent the following very witty "pome" by telegraph to Abraham Lincoln, "With mortar, parxhan and petard, we tender Old Abe our Beauregard." to which we reply. Below: "For traitors we have no regard, We'll hang both thee and Beauregard." [Fort Sumter]

After the Chivalrous defeat of 60 men at Fort Sumter by 12,000 Confederate Troops Jeff Davis sent the following very witty "pome" by telegraph to Abraham Lincoln, "With mortar, parxhan and petard, we tender Old Abe our Beauregard." to which we reply. Below: "For traitors we have no regard, We'll hang both thee and Beauregard." [Fort Sumter]
Lithograph: Signed Woolf, del. Acquisition(?) date on front: Apr. 12, 1906.

Below: "For traitors we have no regard, We'll hang both thee and Beauregard." [Fort Sumter]
